headline: Low Carb Jambalaya
description: Enjoy this low-carb and paleo-friendly version of jambalaya without missing out on any of the flavor!

video.description: See how to make a tasty, meat-filled jambalaya without all the carbs.
video.name: Low-Carb Jambalaya

name: Low Carb Jambalaya
recipeIngredient: 2 andouille sausage, halved lengthwise and cut into 1/4-inch half-moons
3 green bell peppers, seeded and diced
1 teaspoon hot sauce, or to taste
1 pound chicken breast, cooked, cooled, and chopped
1 pound cooked, peeled, and deveined shrimp

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil and butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and andouille sausage and cook and stir until the onion starts to brown, about 10 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes.

Mix in crushed tomatoes, green bell peppers, zucchinis, Cajun seasoning, hot sauce, and chicken broth; bring mixture to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook uncovered until the liquid cooks off and the mixture is thick, about 15 minutes. Stir in chicken and shrimp and simmer until heated through, 1 to 2 minutes.

review.reviewBody: This is the second time in a week I am making this it was so good! The flavor is outstanding.... I like to make it to throw over rice.
I doubled the recipe as we have a large family eating every night. But I added a cup more of broth cuz we like using the juices.
Fantastic!!
Fantastic, so yummy I had seconds. I did add cayenne pepper for a little extra spice and used 1 turkey kielbasa instead instead of the recommended.
Fabulous! Lots of leftovers so we had multiple meals and my husband took it to work with him for lunch. I will definitely make this again!
Super easy, delicious and light! I simmered it for longer than 15 minutes, but it turned out so great! So flavorful AND healthy! Didn’t miss the rice at all!

This was a great couple recipe! Husband and I enjoyed working together in the kitchen to feed our horde. Recipe slightly adjusted to feed 8, and everyone loved it so much there weren't any leftovers! (Used Nandos peri peri medium as hot sauce)
Didn't add hot sauce and it was great!
this was really good. I'm a jambalaya novice too. even my picky husband loved it!
I used pollok instead of chicken. Sooooo good.
Very good even my wife loved it
Love this recipe! I have a chronic autoimmune disease that flares up with certain foods esp grains and this jambalaya recipe is perfect!!! I make

loved this - didnt use shrimp (didnt have - will try next time) and cooked raw chix with sausage at beginning - used veggies on hand- 1/2 green bell, 1 red bell, 1 zucchini, 1 squash, entire can of chix broth (does make it soup-ier), some red and 1 yellow onion - absolutely delish - only had canned diced toms - so blended them to "crush" - we inhaled this! i'll add ocra and celery next time as others suggested. SO FILLING AND PACKED WITH VEGGIES - definitely a keeper! Thx for submitting!! ***edit: ive made this now several times - fam actually likes it better without shrimp (which is cheaper, so yay!) - fam also didnt prefer slimy ocra & i just use diced toms and its great - but the rest of the recipe continues to be as above - so delicious - i now double it and freeze individual servings.

I’ve been trying low carb recipes for my 14 year old as a recommendation by his doctor. I look for meals with lots of veg and protein. This one fit that criteria. Honestly it tasted good. Had a bit of heat to it which was alright with us. But for the effort and food cost it just wasn’t worth it.
Amazing recipe when you want jambalaya but on a low carb diet. Definitely a keeper in our kitchen!
Delish! We cooked the peppers for the last 5 minutes with the onions so they would be more done.
This actually came out really cool. I made it exactly as the recipes says! Came out perfect! Definitely will make again!
I cut back on the green peppers and added celery. Served over riced cauliflower it is amazing!
Turned out great, used a chicken spicy Italian sausage. 1 can of tomato pasta and 1- 12.5. Oz can of chicken breast

This came out great!! I'm not strictly low carb but am on a cut and needed a high protein, low cal recipe for meal prepping. This was everything I needed and very tasty to boot, definitely a keeper. I wasn't really even a fan of Jambalaya till I tried this recipe.

We doubled the recipe, added an extra 1lb of shrimp instead of chicken and a little extra Cajun seasoning to even out the double batch.

OMGOODNESS!!! SOOOOO yummy!!! 
Pre, even though kinda messy, TOTALLY worth it! 
Used about 1/2 received onion, peepers and, garlic, yet super tasty. Fatima enjoyed sooooo much, had the next night for dinner,,!
Sooo good. One of best recipes I've found on here. Fantastic!

Made this for the first time and it turned out amazing! I only used one green pepper because my husband doesn’t really like them. I also added corn, used 4 of the sausages, and more chicken broth then called for. I’ll definitely be making it again!
Looovvveee this. I did add hot sauce... a lot. And cauliflower rice at the end. Yuummmyyyy all my friends love it too!! thanks for the recipe!!
I made this exactly by the recipe! It was delicious! My husband loved it and I will definitely make it again.

I have made this several times and it’s just wonderful! Only substitution I make is adding frozen sliced okra instead of the zucchini. Wonderful flavor and so different from the usual low carb recipes! I serve it over cauliflower rice, and cook real rice for the carb eaters in the family. Everyone loves this dish!
It's pretty spicy! Used Andouille sausage & made my own Cajun spice from recipe here. Husband said, 'This is spectacular!'. Guess he liked it.
Prepared it as it. It has a good taste. Probably would change it up a bit the next time
I love this recipe!! I added rice cauliflower to it, delicious!!

This is a keeper! Made it exactly as presented using the Cajun Spice in a Jar recipe on this site. Served it over Cauliflower rice. Husband asked if we could have the leftovers the next night (which never happens....he's not big on leftovers) and I think it was even better. Thank you for sharing!

This was, in a word, amazing. I was out of hot sauce so added a sprinkle of cayenne. So, so good. Might use stewed or diced tomatoes next time for a twist but would make it again as written too. Didn’t miss the rice one bit.
The best ever. My husband and I live this.
It was really good. I made small adjustments only because of what I had on hand but still turned out great! I'll definitely make it again.

Very good! We are on a no carb diet and needed something new. Is a 2nd helping meal. We didn’t miss the rice. I used Kielbasa sausage & boneless skinless chicken thighs. Didn’t make any other changes.

Wow! I thought this was a great recipe. I cooked a chicken breast and then the shrimp, both lightly seasoned with Cajun seasoning. Then followed the recipe, with the exception of using 1 green, 1 red , and 1 yellow bell pepper and a can of diced tomatoes instead of the crushed (it's what I had). LOVED it, as did my husband. I will definitely make this again.
Turned out great.

I usually follow All-Recipe recipes exactly. But I make a great traditional Jambalaya with rice using the recipe I got from a famed New Orleans chef, Austin Leslie. So I transposed his ingredient choices into this one and ended up with a very good low carb version.

First, real New Orleans dishes usually start with what they call the Holy Trinity. That's onion, celery and garlic. So just add a cup of chopped celery to the onions when you sautee them.

Instead of crushed tomatoes, Austin used canned whole plum tomatoes. But for extra spice, drain 2 cans of Rotel tomatoes with chiles. Works great and tastes better. Austin doesn't use bell peppers...I used one.

For people who can eat carbs, this is even better spooned over rice. I love having the option to eat it either way.
I also added 2 cups of kale. Delicious

I made this as is - and used the Cajun Spice Mix recipe from this site and it was quite spicy - but I also just shook the hot sauce bottle quite a bit, so there's that - but oh, this is so good. I am watching my carbs but was craving andouille (one of my favorite things in the world) and this totally satisfied that craving. Normally, I would miss the rice, but I didn't. I highly recommend making this as is. Thank you, Morgan for this fantastic recipe.

Tasty and hearty. In addition to carbs, I'm avoiding pork so smoked turkey sausage and extra hot sauce filled in for the Andouille. I had no zucchini but I do have a bad cold so I substituted frozen okra, which I prefer anyway, and I didn't have to run to the store. Thank you for posting this recipe!
I made this, but, cut down on the cayenne, as the hot, spicy food doesn't totall yagree with her. The recipe still turned out great and we'll make it again.

Quick and delicious. I was short 1 pepper and used celery instead. I used raw shrimp and added just at the end to cook. 
Everything else was the same. This will be part of our "cook often" dishes.
Very good. I added frozen cut okra and a bag of riced cauliflower. Used a 28oz can of tomatoes to absorb the extra ingredients.

This recipe is fantastic! I bought raw chicken breasts and shrimp and cooked them ahead of time using the cajun seasoning for added spice. I also added extra hot sauce (used Cholula- my favorite). It turned out nice and spicy. My kids loved it! Definitely will make again.
Wow! First time making this and we love it!
This has been in our families dinner rotation for a couple years now. Absolutely delicious.
I omitted the hot sauce and otherwise made it exactly as written. Fabulous. For the carb eaters in the family. I had rice available on the side.
I made this last night for dinner. I didn't expect it to be so flavorful without simmering for longer.
Wonderful flavor, filling, and easy to make. Using pre-cooked shrimp and chicken speed this up and made the cooking easy. I will make again.
Favorite low-carb dish.
Very good and easy to make.

As someone from Louisiana, never put shrimp and tomatoes in a Jambalaya. 

For a breakfast favorite, try Gritalaya. Jambalaya with grits instead of rice!
Super recipe. Could use more kick/heat.
Turned out so good. Everyone loved it! Didn’t add hot sauce but used hot sausage. Will make this again.

So savory and delicious. Prepared this with a good foody friend this evening. We left out the bell pepper and added carrots. We were wondering how the zuc would hold up and it was a nice addition to this non traditional Jambalaya recipe. this recipe will definitely be shared around with friends and family
loved it... can't wait to make more
Made exactly as recipe says, it’s really good and perfect for a low carb soup. Very filling and flavorful.

We loved this! I was searching for something hearty and filling while doing keto as my husband gets discouraged when our dinners are a little lighter (makes you more prone to want to snack). This was very filling and excellent flavor. We had plenty of leftovers which was great for lunches. My children age 7 & 10 don't like a lot of spice so I scooped them a bowl before I added the creole seasoning!
It was amazing. I put cauliflower rice in mine.
Used little smokies to save time. Used some butternut squash in place of some of the zucchini. Turned out great. Makes a lot, I will do half recipe next time.

I made per the instructions but used 1.5 lbs of chicken and shrimp and added 1 bag of cauliflower rice. (Not frozen) This dish is amazing and it will be in regular rotation on my meal prep schedule!! It made 6.5 servings for me.

I made this recipe for my wife and I and pretty much followed it to the tee with only a few small exceptions I can think of. The only things I changed, were the hot sauce, and chicken. I instead used 1 tablespoon of chipotle chili powder. It gave it an extra nice kick. I also used raw, unbreaded chicken tenders instead of chicken breast. But this recipe did turn out great and tastes great. Also, the directions are misleading. They do not tell you to cook the chicken and shrimp ahead of time, and instead just assume that you either have cooked the chicken and shrimp, or are using pre-cooked products. I cooked the chicken and shrimp in together on low heat using kosher salt, black pepper, and Cajun seasoning.

After making it I was questioning how it would taste...... but !!! This stuff is great!! Mine packed a punch and was sooo yummy. It’s great for all those low carb diets out there and people trying to get in a lot of protein. I added mushrooms to mine and made it with red and orange peppers instead of green. Mine made 12 cups total and a 3 cups serving only has around 400 calories and over 50 grams of protein ????

This jambalaya was incredible. You definitely don’t miss the rice! I found it took a lot longer to simmer off the liquid than the recipe suggested, but the longer is simmers the stronger the flavors so it’s definitely worth the wait. I may add celery next time but it’s not needed, this is a very hearty and filling dish.

Careful with the Cajun seasoning. it was the perfect amount of spice for my boyfriend, but too spicy for myself and the 10 year old. While it burned so good, it will be perfect next time for us with less spice.
It is a keeper!

I have had original Baton Rouge style jambalaya in Louisiana many times. And although this recipe isn't nearly as complicated as the original family recipes , it's a great quick alternative!
I'm a big low to no carb cooker and look for new recipes all the time and this was perfect!
I didn't have a few of the ingredients and had to substitute the best I could.
I used mushrooms and red and green bell pepper, instead of zucchinis. And turkey sausage, and frozen shrimp from trader joe's. I didn't have any chicken so just added more sausage and shrimp.
I also didn't have cajun seasoning on hand so just added my own seasonings separately: salt, ground pepper, red pepper flakes, garlic powder, dried basil, and smoked paprika. 
It was more soupy at first, but I simmered it for a while and was just the right amount to serve with brown rice, which absorbed the liquid and made it so flavorful!
Very good on a cold night!! We used cauliflower rice. Thanks for the recipe
This was amazing the whole family loved it. Thank You
Followed the recipe closely - and found it almost inedible because of saltiness. I’m not sure where ir
Great flavors and with the extra veggies, didn’t even miss the rice!
This is really easy and really good. I cheated and used frozen peppers and onions and I could not tell.
Delicious and simple. I didn't add the zucchini for fear that it would be too mushy.

I substituted celery and julienne sliced dried tomatoes for red peppers (similar consistency and some additional color). Also used a red onion. VERY flavorful and spicy dish. Keeps for a few days in the fridge. Reserve time for chopping...

Made this and did not change anything. One of the best jambalaya recipes I've made and low carb. All the ingredients were wonderful with the perfect amount of Cajun seasoning. This is one we will definitely make again and again and again.......well you get the point.
Yummy!!

Quite tasty for low carb Keto
Left out squash, didn't have any on hand. Everything else by the receipe but used Ragin Cajun Andoule So no extra heat or spice was needed
This recipe should remain untouched in regards to its ingredients. I would make it again in a nano second.

I made two mistakes while making it. The first one was not taking off the brown paper that was on the Andouille sausage and the second was forgetting to take the shrimp out of the freezer and waiting for it to thaw out before I put it in the pot. The jambalaya had a real good flavor and I will be making it again. It's a keeper for us.
This is a GREAT low carb meal! I've made this several times now and love it! The only thing I did differently was use two cans of tomatoes and used red and yellow peppers instead.
I really like the taste so far but I'm simmering on the stove and will have for dinner tomorrow. I'm hooping the longer cooking time punches up the flavor profile!
Sooooo yummy! I forgot to get shrimp but it still ended up so tasty and quick to make
Definitely not something to call Jambalaya but it wasn't bad. A good bit of time and energy required to make it with all the veggies to cut up. I would call it a Cajun stew. I won't make it again.

So good!! I made it like a soup and in the crock pot added an additional 2 cups of broth and extra Cajun seasoning. Sautéed all meat and onions in pan added seasonings before transferring to crockpot. Highly for 3-4 hours

I tried it with Andouille sausage and with smoked beef sausage and I prefer the smoked beef sausage. With the Cajun spice, the Andouille is just too much flame on the tongue for me. Also, I like to add red, orange and yellow bell peppers in addition to the green bell peppers, a skimpy 1/4 cup of rice and skimpy 1/4 cup of orzo. This dish is absolutely awesome on cold winter days. The spiciness warms you from the inside out. Love this recipe!!

This turned out great. Having just switched to a low carb diet I was looking for a good Jambalaya recipe and this worked. I did not change the recipe at all but made it as is. I also cooked some rice on the side for those in the family who were not doing low carb. It was a big hit by the whole family, what little leftovers there were were gone the next day.

Almost as good as Bubba's Jambalaya (my favorite but not low carb). Highly recommended.

I didn't use this exact recipe, but make this quite often....minor suggestions to try..
2 green peppers and 2 jalapenos....drop zucchini and add head of cauliflower rice.. 2 cans of okra....wicked good.

This was very good. I used only 1 TBS of cajun season, and used Smoked sausage. I LOVE asparagus and Costco had fat ones so I thew a few in. Otherwise, made as written! I used cauliflower bits in place of rice. Cilantro would have been a nice addition

I have made this several times because I love it! Once I added ham because I can't eat shrimp but usually I just use the chicken and chicken sausage. I will also add whatever vegetables I have on hand along with the zucchini, onion and I use a red, orange or yellow pepper. A key is the Cajun spice you use. I found one that has 11 different spices in the mix and was organic. I loved the flavor.

Delicious! I changed it just a bit, due to personal taste and what I had on hand. No shrimp, as I don't care for it. 1 1/2 lb of smoked sausage, 1 1/2 lb boneless skinless chicken breast meat, 1 large green pepper. Everything else according to recipe. Very very good. Great spice. Yes it's not really jambalaya, without rice and shrimp, but for those of us watching carb intake this is wonderful! Thank you!

I love this recipe. I have to admit that I take A LOT of shortcuts. I buy the vegetables (already sliced/diced) from the grocery store freezer section....ochre often gets added too. I buy a roaster chicken and the frozen no-tail shrimp. All I really do is cut up the andouille sausage. It assembles very fast and it's delicious.

Delicious exactly as written. The heat and flavor were perfect for me and my husband. I added an extra can of tomatoes and an extra cup of broth to it before my kids had it because they would've found it spicy.

Couldn't get andouille sausage so I used a pork breakfast sausage instead. Used orange and red bell peppers along with the green to give some color. I let simmer for longer than called for. Honestly don't miss the rice so will be making again! Delicious!
My whole family of 4 loved this dish. My husband and I have never been huge fans of jambalaya but this spin on it was just the ticket for us! Thank you.
everyone loves it ! great recipe

Only change was to add a little bit of okra (I like okra). Outstanding flavor. heats up great the next day. Made this because my Wife is a diabetic and was put on a low carb diet. I will make this again because it's just packed with flavor.

As the recipe is I would rate it three stars. To make it five stars I added a poblano, jalepeno and celery. What cajun recipe doesn't have celery? After the onions and sausage were done I added all the vegetables and cajun seasoning (slap yo mamma). After they browned a bit I added the liquid ingredients. I also made some cauliflower rice to put the jambalaya on. It's a little non-traditional and delicious. I'll be making this a lot.
So good! We didn't miss the rice at all!
